questions.question: What is the base value for a homoannular diene system according to Woodward–Fieser rules?

explanations.a: Incorrect: 214 nm is for heteroannular diene.
explanations.b: Correct: 253 nm is the base value for homoannular diene.
explanations.c: Incorrect: 202 nm is for 5-membered cyclic ketone.
explanations.d: Incorrect: 195 nm is for unsaturated acids/esters.

questions.question: How much does each alkyl substituent or ring residue contribute to the λmax in a conjugated diene system?

explanations.a: Incorrect: 10 nm is for α-position in carbonyl compounds.
explanations.b: Incorrect: 12 nm is for β-position in carbonyl compounds.
explanations.c: Correct: 5 nm per substituent in diene system.
explanations.d: Incorrect: 30 nm is for conjugation extension.

questions.question: Which type of diene has conjugated double bonds in different rings?

explanations.b: Correct: Heteroannular means in different rings.
explanations.c: Incorrect: Endocyclic refers to location of double bond.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Exocyclic refers to bond connected outside ring.

questions.question: What is the contribution of a double bond that extends conjugation in λmax calculation?

explanations.a: Incorrect: 18 nm applies to γ or higher substituents.
explanations.c: Incorrect: 5 nm is for exocyclic bond or alkyl in dienes.
explanations.d: Incorrect: 12 nm is for β-substituents in carbonyl compounds.
